title: Report: NBA won't discipline Cavs' Smith for Game 2 shove
text:
May 16, 2018 / 8:41 PM / Updated 8 minutes ago Report: NBA won't discipline Cavs' Smith for Game 2 shove Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
Cleveland Cavaliers guard JR Smith will not face discipline from the NBA for his hard foul on Boston Celtics forward Al Horford in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference finals, according to a report from ESPN. Al Horford (42) attempts a free throw against the Cleveland Cavaliers after a technical on guard JR Smith (5) during the fourth quarter of Greg M. Cooper-USA TODAY Sports
Smith shoved an airborne Horford on a drive to the basket late in the fourth quarter. Smith was assessed a flagrant-1 following a review by the officials.
“It was a good call,” Smith said postgame.
